variable.name: plate
variable.description: ELISA Plate ID that sample was run on(character variable)
variable.comment: PLATE variable indicates date the plate was run as well as the initials of the Tech who ran it. If there were more than 1 plate run on specific date by the same Tech, it is delineated by a B.

variable.name: cvper
variable.description: Percent CV for those run in duplicate
variable.value: Unknown or only run in singleton

variable.name: res1
variable.description: Retinol Binding Protein 4 Result for first well(sample type: plasma)
variable.comment: If RES1 was below the lowest detectable limit of 0.224 ng/mL, then RES1 was set at 0.2. The value was then divided by 1000 to get the units of micrograms/mL.

variable.name: res2
variable.description: Retinol Binding Protein 4 Result for second well(sample type: plasma)
variable.comment: If RES2 was below the lowest detectable limit of 0.224 ng/mL, then RES2 was set to 0.2. The value was then divided by 1000 to get the units of micrograms/mL.
variable.value: Unknown or only run in singleton

variable.name: rbp4
variable.comment: For flag = 1, 2 or 3, RBP4 is the same as RES1 regardless of whether the sample was done in duplicate or not. For flag = 4, RBP4 is the mean of RES1 and RES2 because all controls were done in duplicate. If RBP4 was below the lowest detectable limit of 0.224 ng/mL, then RBP4 was set at 0.2. The value was then divided by 1000 to get the units of micrograms/mL. RBP4 values by flag are as follows:11.61 - 114.35 for flag = 117.15 - 64.38 for flag = 216.00 - 80.93 for flag = 324.74 - 39.06 for flag = 4.

variable.name: flag
variable.comment: When doing analysis, use flag = 1 and 2. Phantoms have their FHS ID number listed under IDTYPE and ID, with their phantom id number listed under PHANTOM_ID. When looking at phantom samples, use flag = 3 records as well as their corresponding FHS ID number in either flag = 1 or 2.
variable.value: FHS samples that can be used for analysis, done in singleton
FHS samples that can be used for analysis, done in duplicate

variable.name: phantom_id
variable.comment: Phantoms have their FHS ID number listed under IDTYPE and ID, with their phantom id number listed under PHANTOM_ID.

variable.name: assay
variable.description: Assay Indicator for the RBP4 Variable(character variable)
variable.value: RBP4 value was not within the normal limits of the kit and is set to a fixed number
RBP4 value was within the normal limits of the kit and is a real value
